SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.Model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Model.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Game extends Object implements Serializable
Class that describes the game, all of its most important methods and attributes It contains all the data and information necessary to permit the game to be saved and resumed if interrupted This class is also used to initialize all the components at the very beginning of every game and keeping them updated
See Also:

    boolean
    validSelection()
    The method returns a boolean value, based on the coordinates of the selected tiles from the game Board.
    It checks firstly if the number of the selected tiles is not greater than three, than based on the number (one, two or three).

    If the tiles are only one, it checks if the tile has at least one free side.

    • getTilesInCurrPlayerHand

      public ArrayList<Tile> getTilesInCurrPlayerHand()

    • validSelection

      public boolean validSelection()
      The method returns a boolean value, based on the coordinates of the selected tiles from the game Board.
      It checks firstly if the number of the selected tiles is not greater than three, than based on the number (one, two or three).

      If the tiles are only one, it checks if the tile has at least one free side.
      If the tiles are two, it checks if the x coordinates or the y coordinates are the same, then it sorts the array containing the coordinates (sorting on the y if the selection is horizontal, or on the x if the selection is vertical), then checks if the absolute value of the difference of the y values (x values) is 1, meaning the tiles are one next to the other, then checks if the selected tiles have one free side.
      For the selection of three elements, it first checks if the x values or the y values are the same (same row or column), then order the arraylist by the x or the y values, then checks if the difference between the coordinates (x or y values) are -1, meaning the values (x or y) are consecutive, then it checks if the coordinates have at least on free side.
      Returns:
      return true if the selection is valid, false otherwise

    • selectTiles

      public void selectTiles(int x, int y)
      add to the arraylist, if its size is lower than 3, the coordinates of the tile the current player wants to take from the board
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate
      y - y coordinate
